alert.note: Alert for Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 5:36PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Pike County through 630 PM CDT... At 536 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Troy Municipal Airport, or near Troy, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Goshen, Banks, Antioch, Ansley, Troy Municipal Airport, Troy University, Monticello, Springhill, Josie, Brundidge Municipal Airport and Mossy Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
